intro: Guatteria megalocarpa, commonly known as the giant guatteria, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
